metadata.title: CVE-2017-15393 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient Policy Enforcement in Devtools remote debugging in GoogleChrome prior to 62.0.3202.62 allowed a remote attacker to obtain access toremote debugging functionality via a crafted HTML page, aka a Referer leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-browser-l10n - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-chromedriver - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380').
